glsa.title: OpenLDAP: Buffer overflow
glsa.synopsis: The OpenLDAP replication server slurpd contains a buffer overflow that could result in arbitrary code execution.

background.p: OpenLDAP is a suite of LDAP-related applications and development tools. It includes slapd (the standalone LDAP server), slurpd (the standalone LDAP replication server), various LDAP libraries, utilities and example clients.

description.p: slurpd contains a buffer overflow when reading very long hostnames from the status file.

impact.p: By injecting an overly long hostname in the status file, an attacker could possibly cause the execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running slurpd.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
